channel.title: Digital Signal Processing on Tim Ausec
channel.description: Recent content in Digital Signal Processing on Tim Ausec

item.title: ECE538 Week 9:
item.description: The purpose of this week is to understand digital subbanding and single-sideband modulation.

item.title: ECE538 Week 8: Reconstruction Process and Upsampling
item.description: The purpose of this week is to finish up reconstruction and introduce upsampling.

item.title: ECE538 Week 7: Sampling Theory Basics
item.description:
The purpose of this week is to derive the relationship between the CTFT and DTFT, thus dipping our toes into sampling theory.

$$\boxed{X_s(\omega F_s) = X(\omega)}$$

item.title: ECE538 Week 6: CTFT and D/A Conversion
item.description: The purpose of this week is to revisit the continuous time fourier transform (CTFT) to prepare to understand sampling theory and digital to analog (D/A) conversion.

item.title: ECE538 Exam 1
item.description: Topics and concepts covered in the first 5 weeks of ECE538 at Purdue University.

item.title: ECE538 Week 4: Frequency Response of LTI Systems
item.description: The purpose of this week was to understand how pole/zero placement of the impulse response can affect the frequency response of an LTI system.

item.title: ECE538 Week 3: Z-Transform & DT Fourier Transform
item.description: The purpose of this week is to revisit the idea of the Z-transform and DTFT.

item.title: ECE538 Week 2: Autocorrelation and Cross-Correlation
item.description: This is where new content for the course starts. The purpose of this week was to understand autocorrelation, its properties, and its applicatiions.

item.title: ECE538 Week 1: Discrete Time Signals and Systems Basics
item.description: The purpose of this week was to easily slide into the course material and work with convolution in the discrete time case.
